intro: Stigmatodon vellozicola, commonly known as the Brazilian water lily, is a perennial aquatic plant native to South America. It is characterized by its broad, floating leaves that provide habitat for various aquatic organisms. The plant produces white, fragrant flowers that bloom during the warmer months. Its roots are submerged, anchoring it in shallow water bodies. Stigmatodon vellozicola plays a vital role in maintaining water quality and supporting local biodiversity.
